title: Enhancement - As a user I want to be able to Save and Run Rule Checks on a MJ Contract
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a MJ Contract in a Preliminary state
AND user has permission to EDIT the contract
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on "Save and Run Rule Checks" option on MJ Contracts within the Save split button (screenshot attached)
custom_expected:
THEN
- System will run all On Submit and On Save rules for the MJ contract and then save any changes made to the contract.
- A blocking message will display any errors or warnings found, using the standard styling for errors and warnings. 
- The title of the blocking message should be Errors detected and the text "Please update and try again" should be removed.
- The button of the blocking message should be "OK"
- Clicking OK will take the user back to the MJ Contract in view mode and a successful save notification will be triggered
- If no errors/warnings are found use a blue notification saying "No errors detected"

title: User wants to submit a Waiver Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or Club user has navigated to the "Waivers" screen from the left nav
AND page is open in edit mode
AND "Submit to BOC" or "Save" button is available
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Save" or "Submit to BOC"
custom_expected:
THEN system should run a required field and format check according to the data discovery
AND if any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user should receive an error message
AND system should refresh the page and sort the players alphabetically
AND system should check for any On Submit rules violations 
AND system should show successful waiver request submission notification and "Submitted On" and "Submitted By" fields are populated
AND these fields should be  updated if request submitted subsequent times
AND system should go back to view mode when complete

title: BOC user wants to save edits to the day's requests
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user has navigated to the Waivers screen on the transactions dashboard
AND user is viewing the day's requests on the widget in Edit mode
AND Save button is available on the form 
BUT "Submit" button is NOT available
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Save"
custom_expected:
THEN the system should run a required field and formatting check, as well as all "On Submit" rules for any newly entered players
AND if a new request has been entered for an Org which did not previously have a submitted request, then the "Submitted By" and "Submitted On" fields for that request should be populated
BUT if that Org had at least one prior request for this bulletin then the Submitted information should not be updated
AND once all required fields and rules have passed, the form should reload in View mode, with "Request Entry" section collapsed and "Players with Requested Waivers" section expanded

title: User wants PDF of Request Bulletin attached to notification
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as Club or BOC 
AND a Waiver Request Bulletin containing one or more waiver requests has been sent, or notifications re-sent
custom_steps: WHEN user receives notification on their clipboard that the Request Bulletin is available
custom_expected:
THEN description of the notification generated by the sending of the request bulletin or the resending of notifications should be clickable
AND clicking on the description should download the associated pdf of the request bulletin

title: BOC User wants to view an existing Waiver Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with permissions to view "Waivers" tab
AND "Waivers" is an option on the left nav
custom_steps: WHEN user views the "Waivers" tab
custom_expected:
THEN for each request system should display Player Name, Position, MLS, DL (Y/N), DE/Sel (Y/N), Waiver Type, Latest Transaction and date (if one exists in last 30 days), Comments and, for BOC, Request Date, Org and Submitted On date, and Submitted By (username)
AND the layout of the tx should match View mode of provided wireframe
AND fields should match data discovery

title: Release from Roster tx automatically created for Unconditional Release Waiver Requests
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is attempting to submit a Waiver Request for a player
AND the request is a UR Waiver Request
custom_steps: WHEN user submits the UR Waiver Request
custom_expected:
THEN user should be alerted with message "The Release from Roster transaction for <Lastname, Firstname> has been changed to Approved state successfully"
AND Effective Date should be set from the "As Per Release on" date
AND Player's player history should be updated with: Code = URREL Description = Release from Roster, From Org/Club To Org/Club fields to be in black font, To Org/Club fields blank
AND automatically created "As per Release...." comment from waiver request should be saved in the tx
AND player's MJ Roster status should be set to "Released from Roster"
AND system should ensure that a 2nd transaction is not created if set of requests are submitted a 2nd time with UR included

title: BOC user wants to send a Request Bulletin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user has navigated to the waivers screen
AND a submitted waiver request bulletin exists for the selected request date
AND it is after 2PM on request date
AND "Send Request Bulletin" button is displayed
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Send Request Bulletin"
custom_expected:
THEN system should store the current Request Bulletin as it currently exists
AND blue notification should display stating that the request bulletin has been sent successfully
AND screen should be reloaded in View mode, with the Org filter set to "All" and with the "Players with Requested Waivers" section as the only one expanded
AND "Claim" button should appear in the left most column of the Players with Requested Waivers table
AND "Pending" text should be removed from the Bulletin
AND "Results" section should now appear on the form
AND "Resend Notification Emails" button should now be visible

title: Club user wants to see Players with Requested Waivers
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a Club user
AND user has navigated to the waivers screen on transactions dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to a Request Date for which the Request Bulletin has been sent
custom_expected:
THEN a "Players with Requested Waivers" collapsible section should be displayed and expanded by default
AND this section should NOT be visible to Clubs prior to the Bulletin being sent
AND "Players with Requested Waivers" section should match the provided wireframe and data discovery
AND "Players with Requested Waivers" section should contain all of the players for whom waivers were requested by all Orgs for the currently selected Request Date
AND the table should be sorted by Org and then by the player's name (Last, First)
AND the "Request Entry" section should be collapsed by default
AND expanding "Request Entry" should display the players that the Club has requested waivers on for the "Request Date" being viewed
AND if no players are found in the Request Entry section, there should be a line of text stating "No Waiver Requests Found"

title: BOC User wants to submit a Waiver Claim on behalf of a club
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a BOC user
AND user is attempting to submit a Waiver Claim on behalf of a club
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to "Players with Requested Waivers" section of Waivers screen on transactions dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN a Claim button should be displayed for all players if 'All' is chosen in Org dropdown
BUT if user chooses a specific Org, the Claim button should not appear for players from that Org
AND clicking the Claim button should launch a pop-over that allows the user to select a single Org
AND the player's Org should not appear in the dropdown, nor should any other Orgs that have already submitted a waiver claim for the player
AND clicking “Cancel” should close the popover and take no action
AND selecting an Org and clicking "Claim" should  prompt the user to confirm the claim
AND once user has confirmed they wish to proceed with the claim, modal and popover should be dismissed and user should be returned to "Players with Requested Waivers" section
AND the Claim button should remain for the player
AND the Claims/Results section should be expanded for BOC users
AND and user should see "Claimed by ORG date/time" information just as though a Club had performed the Claim
AND if BOC user has entered a Claim on behalf of a club and it is after 1:00PM on the Claim Expiration Date, result should show Claim Expiration Date as mm/dd/yyyy in the result and 12:59 pm as the time in the result

title: BOC User wants to view Waiver Claim results
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as BOC user
AND user has navigated to Waivers dashboard
AND user has selected a Request Date for which the Request Bulletin has already been sent
custom_steps: WHEN user has selects a Request Date for which the Request Bulletin has already been sent
custom_expected:
THEN the "Results" collapsible section should be available
AND this section should be open by default, with the remaining sections collapsed when the current date is equal to the Claim Period expiration date
AND the Results table should match the provided data discovery and wireframe
AND the Results Bulletin Comments text area should be available and visible per the wireframe

title: User wants sending Waiver Results Bulletin to properly set results for players who have secured waivers
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Waivers have been requested for a player
BUT these requested waivers do not yet have a result
AND these requested waivers have NOT been claimed or cancelled
custom_steps: WHEN Waiver Result Bulletin is sent
custom_expected:
THEN results should be set according to the following criteria:
For UR waivers,result text should be set to "Secured for the purposes of UR".
For TRADE waivers for non-optioned players, result text should be set to  "Secured Through Conclusion of Championship Season"
For all other waivers, result text should be set to "Secured until {Waiver Claim Expiration Date}"

title: Automatically create a UR transaction if UR waivers were requested for a player and no team claimed him
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a UR waiver request has been submitted for one or more players
AND these request(s) do not have a claiming Org
AND these requests have not been cancelled
custom_steps: WHEN the Waiver Results Bulletin is sent
custom_expected:
THEN an Unconditional Release transaction should be created by the system and automatically approved if one does not already exist for this player from this Bulletin
AND Transaction Date  should be set to the Current Date
AND Club and Org should be set to request Org 
AND Create, Approved, and Last Changed Date should be set to the current date
AND Waiver Link Transaction ID should be set to requests's Transaction ID 
AND a system should create a non-clickable link in the player’s history
AND system should create entry in Player History (black font), Description = Unconditional Release, Code = UNCRL , From Org/Club
AND system should update player's MJ and MN Roster Status to Free Agent
AND system should Update player's Org and Club to Null
AND transaction should be added to Daily Transaction Bulletin

title: Club user wants to view Waiver Claim Results
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is logged in and viewing Waivers Screen
custom_steps: WHEN user selects a Request Date for which Results Bulletin has been sent
custom_expected:
THEN if the Org had at least one submitted request a table should display containing ONLY the players that the Org requested waivers on, and include the Results as displayed on the Waiver Results Bulletin
BUT if the Org did not have at least one submitted request,  the text "No Waivers Requested" should display
AND 'Players Claimed' subsection should be displayed
AND If the Org had at least one player that they entered a claim on - whether or not they were determined to be the "Eligible" Org, the Players Claimed table should display per the wireframe and include only the players that the viewing Org submitted a claim for
BUT if the Org was deemed to be the Eligible Org, then the "Results" should say "Eligible"
AND if the Org was not deemed to be the Eligible Org, then the "Results" should say "Not Eligible"
AND  if the Org did not have at least one player that they claimed, then the text "No Players Claimed" should display

title: Club user wants to indicate that player has rejected waiver claim
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club user is logged in
AND the club has requested UR waivers for one or more players
AND the UR waivers have been claimed
BUT the UR waivers have NOT been cancelled 
AND a Waiver Claim Assignment has not been created for these waivers

custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Player Reject"
custom_expected:
THEN system should automatically create and submit an Elect Free Agency (Rejection of UR Waiver Claim) Transaction for the associated player
AND "Election Under Article" should be to "Rejection of UR Waiver Claim"
AND Transaction Date should be set to current date
AND system should run all "On Submit" rules, and display any relevant error messages
AND once all On Submit rules pass or are overridden, system should make all Submission Updates

title: Club user wants to see a Create Waiver Claim Assignment button for player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club user is logged in

AND the waivers have been claimed
BUT the waivers have not been cancelled

title: User wants to be able to view detailed history of player's waiver activity during their career

title: BOC user wants to send Waiver Request Bulletin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in and attempting to Send a Request Bulletin
AND "Send Emails" is set to "YES"
AND "Send Notification" is checked off under "Request Bulletin" for BOC and Club users
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Send Request Bulletin"
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate an email to all users listed in the Email Utility Result bulletin with "Send Notification" selected for the Org(s) that have Request Bulletin - Send Notification selected
AND All entered waiver requests should be included in this email
AND system should also generate an email to all users listed in the Email Utility Result Bulletin with "Send Notification, no trades" selected for the Org(s) that have Request Bulletin - Send Notification, No TRDs selected
BUT only OPT, OR and UR waiver requests should be included in that email
AND Subject of the emails should be "mm/dd/yyyy Wvr Req Bulletin" with the Request Date displayed
AND Top of email should display (with proper bulletin #and dates populated):
     -MLB - Waiver Request Bulletin
     -Bulletin #1003353 Mon 08/15/2016
     -Claim period expires Wed 08/17/2016
AND Format of each request should be:
     -Type - Requesting Org
     -Player Last, Player First Middle Initial. - POS - MLS: 0.000
     -Last TX: (as displayed on bulletin in system)
AND Bottom of email should contain:  "ALL WAIVER INFORMATION IS TO REMAIN STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL. DO NOT FORWARD THIS INFORMATION. VIOLATIONS MAY RESULT IN FINES OR OTHER DISCIPLINE. End of Bulletin*"

title: BOC user wants to send Waiver Result Bulletin to BOC users
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in and attempting to send a Waiver Result Bulletin
AND Send Emails" is set to "YES"
AND  "Send Notification" is checked off under "Result Bulletin" for BOC users
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Send Result Bulletin"
custom_expected:
THEN system should generate an email to all users listed in the Email Utility Result bulletin with "Send Notification" selected for BOC that have Result Bulletin - Send Notification selected. All non-cancelled Waiver Requests will be included
AND system should also generate an email to all users listed in the Email Utility Result Bulletin with "Send Notification, no trades" selected for the Org(s) that have Request Bulletin - Send Notification, No TRDs selected
BUT this email should be identical to the one generated for "Send Notification", except no TRD requests should be shown
AND Subject of the emails should be "mm/dd/yyyy Wvr Res Bulletin" with the Request Date displayed
AND Top of email should display (with proper bulletin #and dates populated):
-MLB - Waiver Result Bulletin
-BOC Version (All Clubs) 
AND Format of each result should be:
-Player Last, Player First M.I. - Type (TRD)
-{Waiver Result}
AND if player was not claimed, Waiver Result should match what is displayed on the Results section for BOC (ex: Secured through end of the Championship Season)
AND If player was claimed, then Claiming information is shown. Eligible Org has . Example:
-Claimed by: MIA 8/11/2016 12:58
-TB 8/11/2016 12:32
-LAA 8/11/2016 12:46
-TOR 8/11/2016 12:35
-HOU 8/10/2016 16:16
-NYY 8/11/2016 12:44
(Results of request bulletin 1003347 dated Tue 08/09/2016 which expired on Thu 08/11/2016)
AND Bottom of email should contain -
"ALL WAIVER INFORMATION IS TO REMAIN STRICTLY CONFIDENTIAL. DO NOT FORWARD THIS INFORMATION. VIOLATIONS MAY RESULT IN FINES OR OTHER DISCIPLINE. End of Bulletin *"

AND "Waiver Claim Assignment" is an option in Transactions Advanced Search in the "Transaction Type"

title: User wants to generate Player Notification for a view Waiver Claim Results - Claimed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club user is logged in
AND user's club has Requested UR Waivers for a player that have been claimed but have not been cancelled
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the relevant bulletin
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a Player Notif. button for any UR waiver request that was not Cancelled
AND clicking the Player Notif. button should open the “Notice to Player of UR waiver claim and Right to Terminate Contract" if claimed

title: WCA automatically created for irrevocable waivers upon sending results bulletin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN non-UR Irrevocable waivers have been requested for one or more players
AND these waivers have been claimed
custom_steps: WHEN Results bulletin is sent
custom_expected:
THEN a waiver claim assignment should be created and submitted to BOC for these players
AND for Outright Waivers, the Waiver Claim Assignment should have a Cash Consideration of $50,000
AND for all waivers, the player should be listed as long as the Cash Consideration and that is it
AND clubs should not be able to manipulate the terms at all in the Submitted to BOC state

title: User wants to create Waiver Claim Assignment - Player Accept
custom_preconds:
GIVEN waivers have been requested for a player
AND relevant request bulletin has been sent
AND waivers have been claimed by one or more orgs
AND relevant results bulletin has been sent
AND user has navigated to the player table in Claims/results section on waivers screen
AND "Player Accept" is available in a split button next to this player's name
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Player Accept"
custom_expected:
THEN system should create a preliminary waiver claim assignment for the selected player and redirect the user to the transaction
AND Waiver Claim Assignment should have the creating Org's consideration be for the player, and the claiming Org's Cash Consideration = $1
AND  player the waivers were requested for should NOT be able to be removed from the transaction
AND if a preliminary waiver claim assignment already exists for the selected player, the system should redirect the user to the existing waiver claim assignment instead of creating a new one
AND club users should not be able to add or edit considerations
AND WCA should follow state flow of a trade

title: BOC user wants to approve Waiver Claim Assignment
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in 
AND a Waiver Claim Assignment has been submitted for a player
AND BOC user has navigated to the submitted Waiver Claim Assignment
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN system should run all On Approve rule checks that would run on an outright trade
AND once all rule checks pass, the Waiver Claim Assignment should be marked as "Approved"
AND system should Follow all On Approve rules listed for Outright Trades, including:
- Daily Transaction Bulletin entry
- Player History entry
- Auto-Creation of a Recall where applicable
- Roster Status, Club and Player Info updates.
- Clearing of the Approvals item for the BOC and generation of a notification for the involved Clubs

title: Verify that Club and BOC user can Submit TRD waivers 2 days before Trade Deadline (in order for wvrs to be secured at Trade Deadline)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN current date is equal to Beginning of Trade Waiver Request Period (Based on system dates screen, 07/30/2017 in PRD)
AND club or BOC user is viewing the unsent request bulletin for the current date on the waivers screen
AND club or BOC user is attempting to Submit TRD waivers for a player in order to have them secured by the trade deadline

title: As a Club user I want to be able to save an Investigation Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN a Club user logs into the system
custom_steps: WHEN Club creates or opens an Investigation Request form in Edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN

SAVE
* A Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode. 
* Clicking Save will save the form and its current values and reload the form in view mode. 
* The request's status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the request is being saved. Otherwise the status will not change.  
* After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification. 

CANCEL
* Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made. 
* If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction. 
* If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
* If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

title: As a user I want to be able to delete an Investigation Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has edit permissions for the form in Preliminary states
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks on 'Delete' button(Grey) on the Investigation Request form in view or edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN system will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to delete the form from the system.
**Title:** Warning
**Body:** Are you sure you want to delete this [form]? 
**Hint:** This is a permanent action that cannot be undone.
**Buttons:** Yes, No
AND If they confirm the deletion, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction and a blue notification should be thrown confirming the deletion.
Or If they do not confirm the deletion, then they should be returned to the form and no action should be taken. 
AND Deleted requests should not appear on the front end or be searchable.

AND Clicking Submit will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message. 
AND Clicking Submit will run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other stories - this story assumes they all pass).
AND After the rules have passed, the system updates the status of the request to "Submitted"  
AND System reloads the request in view mode, and displays a successful submit blue notification. 
AND Once the request has been successfully submitted, system creates an entry in green font in Player's Investigation History.

THEN a Submit to BOC button(Blue) will be available to Club users.

AND clicking Submit will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message.

custom_preconds:
GIVEN An Investigation Request is in preliminary or update needed state

custom_steps: WHEN Club user opens the form in edit or view mode
custom_expected:
THEN Waiver Request button(Blue) will be available.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to approve or reject an Investigation Waiver Request

custom_steps: WHEN BOC opens the Investigation Waiver Request in View or Edit mode
custom_expected:

APPROVE:
* BOC Approvers see an "Approve" button in blue when they are viewing a request (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary, Submitted to BOC and Update Needed states. 
* Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting, On Submit and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
* Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
* If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
* A successful blue notification is displayed that states the request was approved.
* If the item was on the Approvals Clipboard, that is removed from the approvals clipboard. 
* Update Player's Investigation History entry for this request to be in black font. 

REJECT:
* BOC Approvers see a "Reject" button in grey when they are viewing a transaction (in view or edit mode) in the Submitted state. 
* Clicking "Reject" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages (all covered in previous stories). 
* Once all On Save rules have passed or been overridden, the status is updated to "Rejected"
* Successful reject notification is displayed. 
* If the item was on the Approvals Clipboard, that is removed from the approvals clipboard. 
* Remove pending investigation history entry.

title: As a BOC user I want an Investigation to automatically be linked to an existing Minor Contract

AND The "Signing Bonus" field should be prepopulated with the signing bonus from the linked contract if no value has been entered.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to link an Investigation to a Contract

AND The popup will contain a complete list of the Major and Minor League Contracts that exist for this player. 
AND The Status of the Contract, Signing Org, Type and the Date Created will display. 
AND The Status will be a hyperlink to navigate the user to the contract. 
AND The user will only be able to select one contract to link. 
AND The button "Select" should be disabled until 1 contract is selected
AND Clicking "Select" will populate the Contract ID field with the ID of the selected contract. 
AND If a contract ID already existed in this field, it is overwritten. 
AND The "Signing Bonus" field should be prepopulated with the signing bonus from the linked contract if no value has been entered. 
AND The "Org" field on the Investigation should be prepopulated with the Signing Org from the contract. If a different Org has already been selected, this Org should be added.

title: Investigation Form - Permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN Investigation permission varies for different user (Test-ARI-viewer@mlb.com, test_boc_viewer@mlb.com, test_boc_admin@mlb.com and test_boc_approver@mlb.com)
custom_steps: WHEN the users logs in
custom_expected:
THEN the following should be true 
-The form has a view only permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view all aspects of the form, but cannot edit anything.  Users without the permission cannot view the form anywhere in the system.
-The form has a "registration" permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view all aspects of the form, but can only edit/create Investigations with a type = Registration. Users without this permission or the admin permission cannot edit or create Investigations anywhere in the system. 
-The form has an admin permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view all aspects of the form, and can edit/create any Investigation type. Users without this permission cannot edit or create non-Registration Investigations anywhere in the system.

title: As a user I want to only see Investigations that I have permission to see within the player's Investigation History (updated for ebis2 investigations)

custom_expected:
THEN Investigation requests should only be visible to the submitting Org, and BOC Investigations
AND Investigation visibility should be controlled by BOC Investigations users on the Investigation form itself
AND if Requesting Org is checked then any Org that has an approved investigation request for the selected investigation should be able to see the Investigation on the player's History
AND if Signing Org is checked, then the Org that the player is currently under contract with should be able to see the investigation on the player's History
AND if All Orgs is checked, then all Orgs should be able to see the investigation on the player's History
AND if BOC Only is checked, then only the BOC should be able to see the investigation on the player's History.

title: As a user I want to add a Signing Bonus to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract 
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN editing the Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a "Signing Bonus" expandable section that appears below the "Options" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section has a toggle that allows the user to include this section in the contract or not. By default, this is set to "No". 
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the section is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the section is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND When the section is expanded, the format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=signing_bonus

title: As a user I want to add an Incentive Bonus to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is an "Incentive Bonuses" expandable section that appears below the "Signing Bonus" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section has a toggle that allows the user to include this section in the contract or not. 
AND By default, this section is toggled to No.  
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the section is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the section is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is an "Add Clause" button present. 
AND Clicking "Add Clause" will add an Incentive Bonus clause to the contract. 
AND The format and fields should follow the wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The "Add Clause" button will remain available, and the user can continue to add incentive bonuses clauses to the contract by clicking it. 
AND Once a clause has been added, there is a trash can icon on the clause, that when clicked, removes the relevant clause from the Contract. 
AND The clause number should always start at 1 and count up from there. Ex: IB1 would be the first clause, followed by IB2 and IB3. If IB2 is deleted, then IB3 would become IB2. 

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=incentive_bonus

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/UEC+-+Incentive+Bonuses

*Not Included in this story:*
  - *Required field and formatting checks*
  - *Pay Schedules*
  - *All post-approval edits*
  - *Duplicating clauses*
  - *Maximums Tables*

title: As a user I want to add an Options clause to a UEC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC user is logged in with permissions to create an Employee Contract
AND user initiates an Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_steps: WHEN user is editing Employee Contract (UEC)
custom_expected:
THEN there is an "Options" expandable section that appears below the "Info" section.
AND By default, this section is collapsed.
AND This section has a toggle that allows the user to include this section in the contract or not. 
AND If the toggle is set to "No", then the section is not expandable.
OR If the toggle is set to "Yes", then the section is expandable. 
AND Setting the toggle to "Yes" will automatically expand the section. 
AND Setting the toggle to "No" will automatically collapse the section. 
AND When the section is expanded, there is a "Language" field available, per the data discovery. 
AND When the section is expanded, if the "Option Years" value in the Info section is set to a number greater than 0 (and the contract has been appropriately refreshed), there is an "Add Clause" button present.

title: As a user I want to see what stored language I can choose for a clause
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club or LRD user is logged in with permissions to create Employee Contract
AND user is creating a employee contract
AND the user has selected a clause or covenant 
AND the user has stored a language for the selected clause or covenant
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks the Language dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN Only stored languages that are on or after their effective dates, and have not been superseded by another effective date will display as an option. (Ex: a language with an effective date of 4/3/2012 will not display if there is a story with an effective date after 4/3/2012 but before today)
AND Only stored languages that are Approved will display as an option.
AND Only stored languages that belong to either LRD or the signing Org will be displayed in the dropdown.  
AND Only one language type can be selected in each clause.
AND Each clause or covenant in a contract that allows for the use of language displays a dropdown where the user can select which type of language they would like to use for that clause. 
AND The dropdown will contain a "Custom" option along with any stored language options that are able to be used for the specific contract.
AND Only one language type can be selected in each clause.
AND Upon selecting "Custom" as the language for the clause, a WISYWIG editor will appear in the contract form. 
AND Users will be able to use the WISYWIG editor to construct custom language using basic formatting such as italics, bolding, underlining and bullet points.
AND Any formatting that will not be supported in printing should not be an option in the WISYWIG editor. 
AND If the user changes the selection from "Custom" to a stored language, if they re-select "Custom" before navigating away from the page the WISYWIG should display any previously entered data. 
AND Each clause or covenant in a contract that allows for the use of language displays a link that allows the user to navigate quickly to the stored language for that clause or covenant. 
AND When there is a stored language selected as the language for a clause, clicking the "View" link will open a new/tab window to display the stored language loaded. (this story does not include the ability to change the language you are viewing).

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Expire UEC batch
custom_preconds: GIVEN CLUB and BOC user  has employee permission
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to "Major Contracts" section on the batch screen
custom_expected:
THEN user should see "UEC Expiration Batch" option 
AND Clicking "UEC Expiration Batch" opens the batch in the batch screen. 
AND The batch parameters display per the batch requirements. 
AND A "Run" button is available. 
AND Clicking "Run" will run the batch according to the selected parameters. 
AND When the batch is run: 
    - Get all approved contracts to be expired (contracts whose latest service end date is in the past.)
    - Iterate over contracts
    - If there are no options - expire the contract
    - If the last year is an option year - expire the contract only if none of the options are exercised.
    - Any employees' whose contracts were expired and have contracts that were in "Approved for Next Season" state are updated to "Approved" state
    - If the employee has an Approved, Approved for Next Season, or Submit Signed UEC for and it is for the same organization as the contract being expired, then if the employee‰Ûªs current position is different than the position in the contract not being expired, a reassign to org transaction is generated for the employee and Submitted to BOC.
    - If any of the contracts being moved to an "Approved" state overlap with a current Approved contract, then update the status of the existing Approved contract to "Superseded" 
    - Any employees' whose contracts were expired who do NOT have an Approved, Approved for Next Season, or Submit Signed UEC for the same organization as the contract being expired should have a Remove Employee from Org transaction generated for them and Submitted to BOC.      
AND Results will only include employees who had a contract updated by the batch and should display in the "Batch Results" widget. Available columns should be Errors, Player ID, Name (Last, Roster), Org (current Org), Contract ID, Signing Org (Org contract is with), 
Start Year, Non Option Yrs, Option Yrs, Status (Contract Status)
AND Batch run information should display in the batch history widget.

Batch Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/11.+UEC+Expiration+Batch

title: Employee Contracts - Viewer Permissions- BOC
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Employee Contracts Viewer Permissions

custom_expected:

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction for an employee

AND "Assignments" should be an option under the secondary dropdown. 
AND "Assign as 7th Coach" should be an option in the third level dropdown when "Assignments" is selected.
AND Selecting "Assign as 7th Coach" from the Create New will check to see if there is an existing Preliminary transaction of the same type for the same employee created within 10 days of the current date. 
AND If a preliminary already exists, the system will load the existing transaction in Edit Mode instead of opening a new transaction. 
OR If no preliminary transaction created within the last 10 days already exists, then the system will load a new Preliminary transaction in edit mode. 
AND Transaction should follow the wireframe and data discovery.

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction for an employee
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in employee profile
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new Assign as 7th Coach transaction in edit mode for an employee
custom_expected:
THEN Save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode.
AND Clicking Save will save the transaction and it's current values.
AND Transaction status will be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status will not change.
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification.
AND Whenever the form is in edit mode, the user will see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made.
AND If they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction.
Or If they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded in the default mode (view/edit) for the current transaction state, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected.
OR If they do not confirm the cancellation then the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

Wireframe:
http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

http://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=assign_as_7th_coach

title: As a BOC user I want to approve an Assign as 7th Coach transaction

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to suppress an Assign as 7th Coach transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN an Assign as 7th Coach transaction has been approved or Reversed for a player
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user is on Assign as 7th Coach transaction in view or Edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN Users that have permission to suppress the form will see a "Reverse and Suppress" option on Approved transactions and a "Suppress" button on Reversed transactions, both in grey, in either view or edit mode.

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Assign as 7th Coach transaction

http://aceshn.axshare.com/#p=voluntary_designation

title: Assign as 7th Coach - Editor permissions
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC or Club admin account logs in
custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:
THEN they should have the following Editor permission
BOC users with a Editor permission can:
  -Can view and Print all employee transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Employees.
  -Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all employee transactions for Employees. 
  -Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Employee transactions.

Club users with a Editor permission can:
  -Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs to.
  However, there are exceptions:
       1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
       2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
  -Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
       1. Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
       2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
       3. Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Minor League transactions for Minor League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".

custom_steps: WHEN the user is in employee widget
custom_expected:

  --Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

-Club users with a Viewer permission can*:
  --Club users with this role can view and print all employee transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved employee currently belongs to.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
 -Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) employee transactions including other club's employee transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2.  Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the employee involved is 
         currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new Assign/Reassign Employee transaction for an employee

title: As a user I want to submit a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction to the BOC for approval
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with create/submit permissions for Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new preliminary or rejected Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_expected:
THEN a Submit to BOC button is available to Club users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button is blue. 
AND Submit button is available for BOC users when the transaction is in a preliminary or rejected state in edit mode or view mode. The button is grey.
AND clicking Submit will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. If any fields are missing or formatted incorrectly, user will receive an error message. 
AND clicking Submit will run the On Submit rules check (each covered in other stories - this story assumes they all pass).
AND after the rules have passed, the system updates the status of the transaction to "Submitted to BOC"  
AND system reloads the transaction in view mode, and displays a successful submit blue notification.  
AND once the transaction has successfully been submitted, the system sets the employee's pending Status to "Temporarily Inactive".
AND when a transaction reaches a status of "Submitted to BOC" an approval item will be generated and display on the BOC - Employee Transactions - Admin's Approvals widget. 
AND If a file is attached to the transaction, that is displayed and available for download from the Attachments column of the Approvals widget. 
AND If Comments are populated on the transaction, they display in the Comments column of the Approvals widget.
AND employee name is a hyperlink in the Approvals widget. Clicking on the employee name will open the profile (defaults to History tab) in the same window/tab. 
AND Type" will be a hyperlink. Clicking on the type hyperlink of a submitted transaction will open the submitted transaction in view mode in the same window/tab.
AND once the transaction has been successfully submitted, system creates an entry in employee's History in green font. Code = EETMPIN, Description = Place on Temporarily Inactive List, From Org.

See Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/6.+Place+on+Temporarily+Inactive+List

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Temporarily+Inactive+List

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Employee+Transactions+-+Messages

title: As a BOC user I want to approve or reject a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Employee Transaction Permissions
custom_steps: WHEN the user is viewing Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction (in view or edit mode) in Preliminary or Submitted
custom_expected:
THEN BOC Approvers see an "Approve" button in blue 
AND Clicking "Approve" will run all required field, formatting and On Approve rules checks and display any relevant error or warning messages. 
AND Once all rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Approved"
AND If the item was in edit mode, it is reloaded in view mode. 
AND A successful blue notification is displayed that states the transaction was approved.  
AND Update Player's Player History: Code = EETMPIN , Description = Place on Temporarily Inactive List , From Org/Club fields to be in black font. 
AND Update employee's Status to be Temporarily Inactive. 
OR BOC Approves see  "Reject" button when Temporarily Inactive List tx is in Submitted states 
AND Clicking "Reject" will run all required field and formatting checks and display any relevant error or warning messages (all covered in previous stories). 
AND Once all On Save rules have passed or been overridden, the transaction status is updated to "Rejected"
AND Successful reject notification is displayed. See Messages #15.
AND If the item was on the Approvals Clipboard, that is removed from the approvals clipboard. 
AND Remove pending history entry.

title: As a user I want to edit an existing Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction for an employee
custom_preconds:
See Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Temporarily+Inactive+List
GIVEN a user is logged in with edit permissions for Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a Place on Temporarily Inactive List transaction
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button should be available anytime the form is in view mode if the viewing user has edit permissions for the form in its current state
AND clicking  Edit should reload the form in edit mode, and a Save button should appear in place of the Edit button (no edit button displayed in edit mode)
AND in Preliminary or Rejected state, Club users should be able to edit all portions displayed on the form
AND BOC should be able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions
AND in Approved and Reversed transactions, edit should only give Clubs access to attach new files, but they should not be able to edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery
AND in Approved and Reversed transactions, edit should only give BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. They should also be able to update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, but they should not be able to edit any other part of transaction unless specifically stated in data discovery
AND a Save button should be available anytime the form is in edit mode
AND clicking Save should save the transaction and it's current values and reload the form in View mode
AND transaction status should be set to "Preliminary" if this is the first time the transaction is being saved. Otherwise the transaction status should not change
AND after a successful save the system should display a successful save blue notification
AND whenever the form is in edit mode, the user should see a "Cancel" button on the form in grey
AND clicking "Cancel" should prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel the changes they have made
AND if they confirm the cancellation and the form has not yet been saved in the system, then the form should be closed and no record should be kept. User should be returned to entry point of the transaction
BUT if they confirm the cancellation and the form has been previously saved in the system, then the form should be reloaded into view mode, with none of the edits that were made since the last save and up to the cancellation point reflected
AND if they do not confirm the cancellation then the user should be returned to the form and no action will be taken
